summary: The document is an FBI record detailing Manuel Artime Buesa's pivotal role in the anti-Castro Cuban exile movement, focusing on his involvement with the MRR (Movimiento de Recuperaci√≥n Revolucionaria) and the Bay of Pigs invasion. It explores his activities, the support from the CIA and US government, and the internal conflicts within the anti-Castro groups from the late 1950s to the 1960s. Additionally, it sheds light on the operational hurdles and the criticism Artime encountered within the exile community.
key_findings: Manuel Artime Buesa was instrumental in the MRR and the broader anti-Castro movement, notably in the Bay of Pigs invasion.
Internal strife within the MRR and among anti-Castro groups underscores the movement's complexity.
Support from the US government and CIA for Artime and the MRR included training camps and financial assistance.
Artime's leadership was marred by criticism over his ambitions, leadership approach, and accusations of financial mismanagement.
The document highlights the operational difficulties and setbacks faced by the anti-Castro movement, including failed invasions and internal disputes.
